channel.title: Concurrency Approaches :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: Concurrency means “doing more than one thing at the same time.” In computer science, concurrency can refer to (1) structuring a program or algorithm so that it can be executed out-of-order or in partial order, or (2) actually executing computations in parallel. In modern-day programming, we’re often talking about both. But to help us develop a stronger understanding, let’s look at the two ideas one-at-a-time, and then bring it together.
